title: Drawing, Project for a table, ca. 1700–50
medium: pencil, pen and ink, brush, green-brown watercolor on light brown paper
inscribed: Near top: Larghezza della Tavola Pl. 6 / Al Longhezza della Ta. P 3. 2; at left: tutta L'Altezza P. 2; at right for the foot: Altezza Pl. 8; on the table: [symbol] 4.
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: An eagle standing with spread wings serves as the foot. He holds a short branch in his mouth, another in his right foot, while his left foot stands upon a stone. the base is the earth.

tombstone.epitaph: Drawing, Project for a table, ca. 1700–50. pencil, pen and ink, brush, green-brown watercolor on light brown paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-3198.
